node.title: Russian Medvedev takes out spiteful encounter to advance at Australian Open
node.description: The discontent second seed complained his opponent took too long between points.
node.content: ["An agitated Daniil Medvedev has teed off at the chair umpire and lost his cool in the heat, before steadying to claim a 6-2 7-6(4) 6-7(4) 7-5 win over Maxime Cressy and book his second Australian Open quarter-final.", "The Russian second seed found the American serve-and-volley exponent a tough nut to crack at Margaret Court Arena and his frustration spilled over, after losing the third set.", "Apparently refused a request to leave the court to freshen up, Medvedev barked at French chair umpire Renaud Lichtenstein and complained that Cressy was spending too much time between serves.", "Medvedev's frustration only grew, as eight break points slipped through his fingers in the fourth set, before he finally slipped a forehand past the American in the 11th game to take his serve.", "Medvedev wrapped up proceedings with a slew of huge serves, before stepping in to thrash a forehand winner on match point.", "Last year's finalist, Medvedev next meets Canadian Felix Auger-Aliassime for a place in the semi-finals.\u00a0", "Reuters"]
